page.title: 09The River Spey
page.content: Between the villages of Fochabers and Mosstodloch the{River Spey}flows North to the{Moray Firth.}Sometimes looking very smooth,sometimes very shallow this,the fastest flowing river in Scotland,contains some very dangerous pools with treacherous undercurrents and whirlpools. The{salmon fishing}is world famous and the right to a rod on the river is much prized. There is a local association through which residents of the area can obtain the right,at certain periods to take salmon,trout and finnock. The local hotels also carry permits to allow guests to have a days fishing. Because of the nature of the banks there is a special technique of casting called the Spey cast.
